intro: Maughania angusta, commonly known as the narrowleaf maughania, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
